transcript.title: Order of Australia Council
transcript.content:
Following consultation with the Governor-General, Sir William Deane AC, KBE, I am pleased to announce the appointment of seven new Councillors to the Council of the Order of Australia. The Council for the Order of Australia meets twice a year to consider nominations and to make recommendations for awards in the Order of Australia to the Governor-General.

Rear Admiral ( rtd) Peter Sinclair AC will be the new chairman of the Council, which next meets on 11 and 12 September. This follows a decision by the Chief Justice of the High Court,Sir Gerard Brennan AC KBE to relinquish the position.

The other new Councillors are:

  • Rear Admiral ( rtd) Peter Sinclair AC - Former Governor of NSW
  • The Hon Sir James Killen KCMG  - Barrister and former Federal Minister
  • Mrs Marjorie Turbayne OAM  - President ACT Australia Day Council
  • Ms Anne Fulwood  - News Presenter and member of the Film and Literature Board of Review
  • Mr Allan Border AO -  former Australian Cricket Captain 
  • Dr George Santoro AM  - Former President Australian Medical Association ( Victorian Branch)
  • Ms Sara Henderson  - Grazier/ Author

Lois O'Donoghue CBE AM, Chairman of the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Commnission, has been reappointed to the Council.

All appointments are for two years.

I am delighted that these distinguished Australians have agreed to give freely of their time to this important national cormmittee. They bring with them a breadth of' experience and achievement which encompasses the whole community and which all Australians can respect and admire.

10 September 1996
